arm_group.description: Long Term follow up of patients who received StarGen™  in a previous study

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to examine the long term safety of an experimental gene transfer
      agent, StarGen™, designed to treat Stargardt Macular Degeneration.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Long Term Safety, Tolerability and Biological Activity of StarGen™ in Patients With Stargardt's Macular Degeneration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must have received a subretinal injection of StarGen™

          -  Must have completed protocol SG1/001/10 to Week 48 or undergone an early
             discontinuation visit.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Did not receive StarGen™as part of the SG1/001/10 protocol

intervention.other_name: Long Term follow up of patients who received StarGen™ in a previous study

clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Study to Determine the Long Term Safety, Tolerability and Biological Activity of StarGen™ in Patients With Stargardt's Macular Degeneration

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The number of patients with treatment emergent adverse events

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline function relative to the contralateral eye utilising retinal analytical techniques

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
